title: My Kitchen Rules' handsome French chef Manu Feildel ecstatically confirms new business venture
text:
He's the handsome French chef who is known for his expertise in the kitchen.

And fans of My Kitchen Rules star Manu Feildel can now enjoy a taste of his world-class dishes in their very own home - as he's released a range of sauces in time for barbecue season.

The 45-year-old confirmed the news online, revealing the sauces are now available to buy in Woolworths - claiming the products were 'five years in the making'.

Five years in the making! Fans of Manu Feildel (pictured) can now enjoy a taste of the My Kitchen Rules star's dishes in their own home - as he has released his very own range of sauces

In a video, the proud chef ecstatically gushed: 'People have been asking, where is the sauce? But it's finally in the shops! Come!'

Manu currently has two flavours available in store - a peppercorn, and a lamb and rosemary. He promises a mushroom sauce is 'coming soon'.

After showing off his new range to the camera, Manu beamed widely before excitedly shouting: 'Fantastic!'

'Fantastic!' Manu revealed his new selection of sauces include peppercorn and a lamb and rosemary - while he promises a mushroom sauce is 'coming soon'

Ecstatic: Manu confirmed his brand new range is now available in Woolworths

It was recently confirmed that the popular chef would be reprising his role to My Kitchen Rules: The Rivals, when it returns to screens in 2020.

And at the Seven Upfronts last week, it was revealed there would be a surprise new twist involved for next season.

In a first for the cooking juggernaut, five former teams will go head-to-head in what executives have described as 'the fiercest competition yet'.

Back for more! Channel Seven announced on Wednesday that My Kitchen Rules will return to the network in 2020. Pictured from left to right: Manu Feildel, Pete Evans and Colin Fassnidge

Teams will live together in separate houses, and will be mentored by either returning judges, Manu and Colin Fassnidge, who will now act as mentors.

While Manu and Colin, 45, share their culinary advice, Pete 'Paleo' Evans, 46, will act as judge.

Weekly episodes tease drama and a dash of romance in the lead-up to the ultimate crowning of My Kitchen Rules champion.
description: Fans of Manu Feildel can now enjoy a taste of the My Kitchen Rules star's dishes in their own home - as he has released his very own range of sauces.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
